lead_paragraph: IF any competent war correspondent doesn't have a book manuscript in his luggage these days it isn't because publishers have not cabled him attractive offers. The fame and fortune of the Sheeans, Gunthers and Shirers shine like a beacon before their eyes, as persuasive an inspiration as the fabulous success story of Miss Margaret Mitchell has been to droves of historical novelists.
abstract: Gervasi, Frank; War Has Seven Faces
